name: ISO 3166-1 Country Code Standard
calculation_logic: Field must be a valid two-letter code from the official ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 list. Use a dropdown list in UIs and validate against a reference table.
definition: Ensures all country data uses the standardized two-letter (alpha-2) codes as defined by the International Organization for Standardization.
businessRule: Standardized country codes are essential for accurate logistics, regulatory compliance, and sales territory analysis. Prevents ambiguity from using names like 'Holland' vs. 'The Netherlands'.

name: ISO 4217 Currency Code Standard
calculation_logic: Field must be a valid three-letter code from the official ISO 4217 list. Validate against a reference table.
definition: Ensures all financial transactions use the standardized three-letter codes for currencies.
businessRule: Prevents ambiguity in financial reporting and transactions. Distinguishes between different types of dollars (e.g., USD, CAD, AUD).

name: Address Validation Service (e.g., USPS/Loqate)
calculation_logic: Validate address data via an API call to a service like USPS Web Tools or a third-party provider. Store the standardized address components.
definition: Ensures all physical addresses are validated, cleansed, and standardized against an official postal service database at the point of entry.
businessRule: Accurate addresses are critical for shipping, billing, and customer relationship management. Prevents failed deliveries, returned mail, and customer dissatisfaction.
exampleGood: { street: '1600 PENNSYLVANIA AVE NW', city: 'WASHINGTON', state: 'DC', zip: '20500-0003' }
examplePoor: { street: '1600 penn ave', city: 'Wash DC', zip: '20500' }

name: RFC 5322 Email Format Standard
calculation_logic: Validate against a standard regex pattern for email addresses.
definition: Ensures that email addresses are syntactically valid according to the format defined by the Internet Engineering Task Force (IETF).
businessRule: A valid email format is required for any form of electronic communication with customers, suppliers, or employees.

name: Unique Equipment Identifier (Master Data)
calculation_logic: Identifiers should be issued by a central Master Data Management (MDM) system. Field should be a primary key in asset tables and validated for uniqueness upon creation.
definition: Ensures every significant piece of physical equipment has a single, unique, and non-reusable identifier across all company systems.
businessRule: A unique ID is fundamental for tracking asset performance, maintenance history, and financial depreciation. Prevents duplicate records and ensures data can be aggregated accurately.

name: ISO 6346 Shipping Package ID Standard
calculation_logic: Validate against the regex pattern: [A-Z]{4}[0-9]{7}. The final digit must be a correctly calculated check digit.
definition: Ensures all shipping container identifiers conform to the international standard (4-letter owner code, 6-digit serial number, 1-digit check digit).
businessRule: A valid container ID is essential for tracking, customs, and terminal operations. Invalid IDs lead to lost containers and billing disputes.

name: Standard Carrier Alpha Code (SCAC)
calculation_logic: Validate against the official NMFTA reference table. Often used as a prefix for PRO (tracking) numbers.
definition: Ensures the use of the 2-to-4 letter codes used to identify transportation companies.
businessRule: SCACs are used by ANSI and in EDI transactions for shipping and customs.

name: Bill of Materials (BOM) Version Control
calculation_logic: BOM master data must include 'Version', 'EffectiveStartDate', and 'EffectiveEndDate' fields. Production orders must pull the BOM version that is effective on the planned production date.
definition: Ensures that all Bill of Materials have a clear version number and effectivity dates (start/end) to manage changes over time.
businessRule: Proper BOM versioning is critical to ensure the correct parts are used in production runs. Using an outdated BOM can lead to incorrect products, scrap, and rework.
examplePoor: Using a BOM from last year for a newly designed product.

name: Wellbore Unique Identifier (WUID/UWI)
calculation_logic: Follow the industry-standard format, which often encodes country, location, and well sequence information. Governed by an MDM system.
definition: Ensures every wellbore has a standardized, unique identifier based on its geographic location and other attributes, following industry standards (e.g., PPDM).
businessRule: A unique well ID is non-negotiable for regulatory reporting, production allocation, and geological modeling. Prevents catastrophic errors in reservoir management.

name: E.164 International Phone Number Format
calculation_logic: Store numbers in E.164 format: +[country code][subscriber number]. Maximum 15 digits including country code.
definition: Ensures phone numbers follow the international standard format including country code.
businessRule: Standardized phone numbers enable automated dialing, SMS campaigns, and global communication.

name: ISO 8601 Date-Time Format
calculation_logic: Use YYYY-MM-DD for dates, YYYY-MM-DDTHH:MM:SS for timestamps. Include timezone offset for clarity.
definition: Ensures all date and time data uses the international standard format.
businessRule: Prevents ambiguity in global operations where date formats vary (MM/DD/YYYY vs DD/MM/YYYY).

name: Positive Numeric Values Only
calculation_logic: Implement database constraint: CHECK (value > 0). Add frontend validation before submission.
definition: Ensures numeric fields that represent quantities, prices, or measurements contain only positive values.
businessRule: Negative values in quantity, price, or measurement fields indicate data entry errors or system issues.

name: Mandatory Field Completeness
calculation_logic: Database NOT NULL constraints on required fields. UI validation preventing form submission with empty required fields.
definition: Ensures all fields marked as required/mandatory contain valid non-null values.
businessRule: Critical business processes depend on complete core data fields. Missing values cause process failures.
exampleGood: Customer Name: 'Acme Corp', Order Date: '2024-03-15', Product ID: '12345'
examplePoor: Customer Name: NULL, Order Date: '', Product ID: NULL

name: Unique Identifier Non-Reuse Policy
calculation_logic: Use auto-incrementing integers or UUID/GUID. Implement soft deletes instead of hard deletes. Archive records rather than purging.
definition: Ensures unique identifiers (customer ID, order number, asset tag) are never reused even after deletion or archival.
businessRule: ID reuse causes confusion in historical data, audit trails, and data lineage.
exampleGood: Sequential customer IDs that never repeat, UUIDs for transactions
examplePoor: Reusing customer ID 1001 after deleting previous customer

name: Unit of Measure Standardization
calculation_logic: Maintain UoM reference table. Store both value and unit. Convert to standard unit for calculations.
definition: Ensures consistent units of measure across all systems and data fields.
businessRule: Mixing units (kg vs lbs, km vs miles) leads to calculation errors, safety issues, and operational mistakes.
exampleGood: Weight: 500 KG, Distance: 150 KM, Temperature: 25 C
examplePoor: Weight: 500 (no unit), mixing '1100 lbs' and '500 kg' in same field

name: Hazmat Classification Validation
calculation_logic: Validate against UN Dangerous Goods list. Require Class, Division, Packing Group, and UN Number.
definition: Ensures all hazardous materials are classified according to UN/DOT standards.
businessRule: Incorrect classification can lead to catastrophic accidents, regulatory violations, and criminal liability.

name: Customer Credit Limit Validation
calculation_logic: Real-time check: Order Total + Current Outstanding Balance ≤ Approved Credit Limit.
definition: Ensures all orders are validated against customer credit limits before approval.
businessRule: Prevents bad debt and cash flow issues by enforcing credit controls.
examplePoor: Order $50K, Balance $60K, Limit $100K = Should be flagged/rejected

name: Duplicate Record Prevention
calculation_logic: Implement unique constraints on natural business keys. Use fuzzy matching for customer names and addresses during data entry.
definition: Ensures no duplicate records exist based on defined business keys.
businessRule: Duplicate customer, product, or transaction records cause reporting errors and operational inefficiencies.
exampleGood: Single customer record per unique email or Tax ID
examplePoor: Three records for same customer with slight name variations

name: Date Range Validation
calculation_logic: Validate: Start Date ≤ End Date, Birth Date < Today, Transaction Date ≤ Today (unless future-dated allowed).
definition: Ensures date fields contain logically valid dates within acceptable business ranges.
businessRule: Invalid dates (future birth dates, past delivery dates) indicate errors and must be prevented.
exampleGood: Birth Date: 1980-05-15, Hire Date: 2020-01-10, Term Date: 2024-12-31
examplePoor: Birth Date: 2030-01-01, Hire Date after Term Date

name: Referential Integrity Enforcement
calculation_logic: Database foreign key constraints with appropriate CASCADE or RESTRICT rules.
definition: Ensures foreign key relationships are maintained and no orphan records exist.
businessRule: All child records must reference valid parent records. Prevents data inconsistencies.
examplePoor: Order referencing non-existent CustomerID creating orphan record

name: Latitude/Longitude Precision Standard
calculation_logic: Store as DECIMAL(9,6) for latitude and DECIMAL(10,6) for longitude. Validate ranges: lat [-90, 90], lon [-180, 180].
definition: Ensures geographic coordinates have sufficient precision for business use (typically 6 decimal places).
businessRule: Insufficient precision leads to inaccurate location tracking and route optimization errors.

name: Material Safety Data Sheet (MSDS) Linkage
calculation_logic: Mandatory field in chemical product master. Validate MSDS ID exists in document management system.
definition: Ensures all chemical products have valid MSDS documentation linked in master data.
businessRule: MSDS is legally required for worker safety and emergency response. Missing MSDS is a compliance violation.
exampleGood: Product: Lubricant XYZ, MSDS ID: MSDS-2024-001
examplePoor: Product: Solvent ABC, MSDS ID: NULL or invalid

name: Timestamp Immutability Rule
calculation_logic: Database triggers to auto-populate timestamps. Revoke UPDATE permission on timestamp columns from application users.
definition: Ensures audit timestamps (created_at, updated_at) cannot be modified by users and are system-generated only.
businessRule: Audit trails must be tamper-proof for regulatory compliance and forensic analysis.
exampleGood: created_at auto-set by database on INSERT, updated_at auto-set on UPDATE
examplePoor: Users manually entering or modifying created_at timestamps

name: Percentage Field Range Validation
calculation_logic: Database constraint: CHECK (percentage >= 0 AND percentage <= 100). Frontend validation with clear error messages.
definition: Ensures fields representing percentages contain values between 0 and 100.
businessRule: Percentages outside this range indicate calculation errors or data corruption.

name: Price Precision Standard (2 Decimal Places)
calculation_logic: Use DECIMAL(19,2) datatype for currency fields. Round all calculations to 2 decimal places.
definition: Ensures all monetary values are stored with exactly 2 decimal places for currency precision.
businessRule: Consistent decimal precision prevents rounding errors in financial calculations and reporting.

name: SKU Format Standardization
calculation_logic: Define SKU schema (e.g., Category-Subcategory-Variant-Size). Validate pattern on entry.
definition: Ensures all Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) identifiers follow a consistent format and structure.
businessRule: Standardized SKUs enable inventory tracking, forecasting, and system integration.

name: Serial Number Uniqueness Global
calculation_logic: Central serial number registry. Include manufacturer, model, production date in format.
definition: Ensures serial numbers for physical assets are globally unique across all sites and systems.
businessRule: Unique serials enable warranty tracking, recall management, and asset lifecycle monitoring.
examplePoor: Reusing serial number from decommissioned equipment

name: Temperature Range Validation
calculation_logic: Context-specific ranges: Ambient -50°C to 60°C, Refrigeration -40°C to 10°C, Industrial 0°C to 1500°C.
definition: Ensures temperature readings fall within physically plausible ranges for the specific context.
businessRule: Impossible temperature values indicate sensor malfunction or data corruption.

name: Future Date Prohibition (Transaction Dates)
calculation_logic: Validation rule: Transaction_Date <= CURRENT_DATE (except for explicitly future-dated transactions).
definition: Prevents transaction dates from being set in the future unless explicitly allowed for scheduling.
businessRule: Historical transactions cannot have future dates. Indicates system clock issues or fraudulent backdating.
examplePoor: Shipment Date: 2024-04-01 (when today is 2024-03-15 and not pre-scheduled)

name: Product Category Classification
calculation_logic: Use controlled vocabulary from reference table. Hierarchical structure (Category > Subcategory > Class).
definition: Ensures all products are classified using standard industry category taxonomy.
businessRule: Consistent categorization enables accurate reporting, forecasting, and regulatory compliance.

name: Tax ID Format Validation
calculation_logic: Country-specific validation: US EIN (XX-XXXXXXX), EU VAT (country code + 9-12 digits).
definition: Ensures tax identification numbers follow country-specific format standards.
businessRule: Valid tax IDs are required for invoicing, compliance, and vendor payments.

name: Weight/Volume Consistency Check
calculation_logic: Calculate implied density. Flag if outside expected range for product type (e.g., steel: 7.5-8.0 g/cm³).
definition: Validates that weight and volume measurements are logically consistent based on known density ranges.
businessRule: Implausible weight-volume ratios indicate measurement errors or data entry mistakes.

name: Transport Unit IMO Number Validation
calculation_logic: Validate format IMO + 7 digits with check digit calculation. Verify against IMO ship database.
definition: Ensures all vessel identifiers use valid International Maritime Organization numbers.
businessRule: IMO numbers are permanent vessel identifiers required for port operations, customs, and safety tracking.
examplePoor: IMO 123, vessel name only, invalid check digit

name: Port UNLOCODE Validation
calculation_logic: Validate against UN/LOCODE reference table. Format: 2-letter country code + 3-letter location code.
definition: Ensures all port/location codes use the UN/LOCODE standard format.
businessRule: Standard location codes enable EDI transactions, customs declarations, and logistics optimization.

name: Incoterms® Validation
calculation_logic: Validate against controlled list: EXW, FOB, CIF, DAP, DDP, etc.
definition: Ensures trade terms use official Incoterms® 2020 codes.
businessRule: Proper Incoterms clarify buyer/seller responsibilities for shipping, insurance, and customs.
examplePoor: Free on Board, Cost Insurance Freight, Delivered

name: HS Code Validation (Harmonized System)
calculation_logic: Validate against HS code reference table (typically 6-10 digits). First 6 digits are internationally standardized.
definition: Ensures product classifications use valid HS (Harmonized System) tariff codes.
businessRule: Correct HS codes are mandatory for customs clearance and duty calculation. Errors cause delays and fines.

name: Batch/Lot Number Traceability
calculation_logic: Format: Site-Date-Sequence (e.g., NYC-20240315-001). Link to production run records.
definition: Ensures all manufactured products have traceable batch or lot numbers for quality control and recalls.
businessRule: Batch traceability is essential for product recalls, quality investigations, and regulatory compliance.

name: Asset Criticality Classification
calculation_logic: Mandatory field in asset master. Based on impact of failure on operations, safety, and revenue.
definition: Ensures all physical assets are classified by business criticality (Critical, High, Medium, Low).
businessRule: Criticality classification drives maintenance strategies, spare parts stocking, and failure response protocols.
exampleGood: Primary Power Generator: Critical, Backup Generator: High, Office Printer: Low
examplePoor: All assets marked as Critical, no classification

name: Calibration Due Date Enforcement
calculation_logic: Track calibration date and due date in asset master. Alert 30 days before expiry. Prevent use if expired.
definition: Ensures all measurement equipment has valid calibration with future expiry dates.
businessRule: Using uncalibrated equipment invalidates measurements, fails audits, and creates safety risks.
exampleGood: Scale ID: SCALE-001, Last Cal: 2024-01-15, Due: 2025-01-15
examplePoor: Equipment with expired or missing calibration dates

name: Customer Master Golden Record
calculation_logic: MDM process with fuzzy matching on name, tax ID, address. Merge duplicates into golden record.
definition: Ensures single, authoritative customer record exists per unique business entity.
businessRule: Multiple customer records fragment data, duplicate marketing spend, and confuse customer service.
exampleGood: One master record for Acme Corp with all attributes complete
examplePoor: Three records for Acme Corp, ACME Corporation, Acme Co.

name: Chart of Accounts Validation
calculation_logic: Validate against active Chart of Accounts. Include effective date ranges for accounts.
definition: Ensures all financial transactions post to valid, active general ledger account codes.
businessRule: Invalid or inactive GL codes cause financial reporting errors and failed period closings.
examplePoor: GL Account: 9999-Invalid, posting to inactive/deleted account

name: Permit/License Expiry Tracking
calculation_logic: Mandatory expiry date field. Automated alerts 90/60/30 days before expiry. Block operations if critical permit expired.
definition: Ensures all required business permits and licenses have valid expiry dates tracked and monitored.
businessRule: Operating with expired permits risks shutdowns, fines, and legal action.
examplePoor: Permit with no expiry date tracked or expired permit still active in system

name: Numeric Precision for Measurements
calculation_logic: Define precision requirements per measurement type. Dimensions: 0.1mm, Weight: 0.01kg, Temperature: 0.1°C.
definition: Ensures measurement data is stored with appropriate precision for engineering requirements.
businessRule: Insufficient precision causes quality issues; excessive precision wastes storage and creates false accuracy.

name: Work Order Status Lifecycle Validation
calculation_logic: State machine validation. Prevent invalid transitions (e.g., Created directly to Closed).
definition: Ensures work orders follow valid status transitions and cannot skip required workflow steps.
businessRule: Status must follow defined lifecycle: Created → Approved → In Progress → Completed → Closed.
exampleGood: Status history: Created → Approved → In Progress → Completed
examplePoor: Status jumping from Created to Closed, skipping approval

name: Vendor Master Completeness
calculation_logic: Required fields: Legal Name, Tax ID, Payment Terms, Bank Details, Address. Cannot activate until 100% complete.
definition: Ensures all vendor/supplier records have complete required fields before activation.
businessRule: Incomplete vendor records cause payment failures, compliance issues, and procurement delays.
exampleGood: Vendor with all fields populated and validated
examplePoor: Vendor missing Tax ID or Bank Details but marked active

name: Inventory Count Reconciliation Rule
calculation_logic: Variance tolerance thresholds (e.g., >5% or >$1000 requires investigation). Mandatory reconciliation notes.
definition: Ensures physical inventory counts are reconciled with system records and variances investigated.
businessRule: Unreconciled variances indicate theft, data errors, or process failures requiring investigation.

name: Geofence Boundary Validation
calculation_logic: Define polygon boundaries for sites. Validate GPS readings against boundaries. Alert on violations.
definition: Ensures GPS coordinates fall within defined operational boundaries for facilities or service areas.
businessRule: Coordinates outside geofence indicate tracking errors, theft, or unauthorized movement.
exampleGood: Truck location within terminal fence, equipment within mine lease area
examplePoor: Warehouse equipment showing coordinates in ocean or different country

name: Inspection Frequency Compliance
calculation_logic: Track last inspection date and next due date. Alert when due. Prevent equipment use if overdue for critical assets.
definition: Ensures all assets undergo required inspections at mandated frequencies.
businessRule: Regulatory and safety standards mandate inspection intervals. Missed inspections create liability.
exampleGood: Equipment inspected monthly per OSHA requirements, next due tracked
examplePoor: Equipment with no inspection history or missed inspections

name: Password Strength Requirements
calculation_logic: Minimum 12 characters, uppercase, lowercase, number, special character. No common passwords. 90-day expiry.
definition: Ensures all user passwords meet minimum complexity and length requirements.
businessRule: Weak passwords are the primary vector for security breaches and unauthorized access.

name: Shift Code Standardization
calculation_logic: Controlled vocabulary: DAY, EVENING, NIGHT, ROTATING. Include standard start/end times.
definition: Ensures work shifts are coded consistently across all sites and systems.
businessRule: Standard shift codes enable labor cost analysis, scheduling optimization, and compliance reporting.
